title: 105_hr4679
content: The Act titled "Antimicrobial Regulation Technical Corrections Act of 1998" defines pesticide chemicals under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act is amended to include the definition of pesticide chemicals, which encompasses substances used as pesticides on food, including ethylene oxide and propylene oxide. The definition of pesticide chemicals under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act excludes substances applied on food or in water that comes into contact with food for commercial purposes, except for ethylene oxide and propylene oxide. This exclusion does not apply if the substances are used on raw agricultural commodities in the field or at treatment facilities where only raw agricultural commodities are treated. The definition of pesticide chemicals under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act excludes substances applied on food or in water that comes into contact with food for commercial purposes, except for ethylene oxide and propylene oxide. This exclusion does not apply if the substances are used on raw agricultural commodities in the field or at treatment facilities where only raw agricultural commodities are treated. The substance is applied during transportation between the field and treatment facility, and does not include food contact substances as defined in section 409(h)(6). The substance is included for use in an object with a food contact surface, intended to have an ongoing effect on a portion of the object but not on the food contact surface, or in food packaging. It is not excluded if applied on a semipermanent or permanent food contact surface or intended to have an ongoing effect on the food contact surface. The definition of the term 'pesticide' under the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act does not exclude any substance. Certain substances not included in the definition of 'pesticide chemical' but previously included are subject to existing regulations. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act is amended to consider regulations issued under this section as issued under section 409. Additionally, a technical amendment is made to clarify the language in the Act. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
